fields.description: I registered 5 snapshots as images to create more image data. I then navigate to the images landing page and don't see those images. I can see them via euca2ools, but not the UI. I hit refresh and no good. That should always refresh from the back-end regardless of caching. If caching is getting in the way, we need to mark the cache dirty on modify operations (register/deregister in this case)
fields.summary: registered images fail to show on images page

comments.body: In case it helps, I got helpful info from the bottom of this page: http://beaker.readthedocs.org/en/latest/caching.html

We can't reliably invalidate the cache on package-based installs due to missing features in Beaker 1.5.4.  The Cache object in 1.5.4 is missing the namespace_name attribute, which was added in 1.6 (see https://github.com/bbangert/beaker/blob/v1.6/beaker/cache.py#L282).

A workaround will be needed, either by upgrading to Beaker 1.6.x or by backporting the 1.6 feature into our patched version of Beaker 1.5.4.  Since either approach is fairly involved and risky this late in the release cycle, we're going to need to possibly mark this as a known issue for 4.0.0 and hopefully fix in 4.0.1.
Workaround for 4.0.0 is to wait one hour for the images cache to clear, or to restart the proxy (which clears the cache), assuming we can't get a proper fix in.

We must do something here. Not being able to launch the image you just registered is pretty broken. Having to logout and back in again isn't a good workaround either. We should really talk about this soon to brainstorm cc:[~jloza]
[~dkavanagh], [~kgill], So is this fixed now or do we still need to discuss?

From the comments, it looks like Kamal found a way to clear the cache.
On Apr 9, 2014 10:45 AM, "Jenny Loza (JIRA)" <jira@eucalyptus.atlassian.net>

[~alice]: Do we have an automated test for this?  I'd like to confirm if my fix in pull request 529 works with a package-based install.  I'll try to set up CentOS and a package install on my laptop to manually confirm today.
register a snap as an image ([~alice] says one snap registered is OK) and see if it shows up in the image list!

registered snap as image showed up in images list!

verification done on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 27.0.1
Reopening since invalidation of the images cache is non-deterministed, similar to GUI-908
